title: Teacher Learning Simulation Design Using Mixed Reality Digital Puppeteering

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: For pre-service/in-service teachers: enhancing classroom management competencies through interactions with virtual students in mixed reality environments

learning_goals: Designing at least three effective interaction strategies with virtual students using digital puppeteering in mixed reality simulation environments

Graduate students will select three teaching techniques reflecting cultural/linguistic diversity (e.g., translation tool utilization, cultural context explanation, multicultural case integration) in virtual classroom scenarios, produce a 10-minute mock lesson video applying these techniques, and achieve ‘excellent’ ratings in at least four of five peer evaluation rubric items.
Applying three out of five mixed reality-based teacher instructional design principles to real educational contexts

Learners will submit one mixed reality (MR) simulation design proposal within a week through project-based assessment, achieving ‘excellent’ ratings in at least two of three evaluation criteria (technical feasibility, educational effectiveness, creativity).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
